intro: Legousia conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers are usually blue or purple in color. Legousia conferta is often found in alpine and coastal regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
